FuncDef:
The precision command sets the precision of a throughput test for a generalflow test. If the difference between the test result and actual throughput is less than the specified precision, the throughput test is successful and ends.
The undo precision command restores the default precision.
By default, the precision is 1000 kbit/s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the throughput test precision.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10000, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the precision in a throughput test for a generalflow test, run the precision command. The precision is a condition for ending a throughput test. If the difference between the test result and actual throughput is less than the specified precision, the throughput test is successful and ends.
Prerequisites
The precision command can only be used in throughput tests for a generalflow test.
Precautions
You cannot change this configuration of a running test instance.
